titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I left Worcester under bright sunshine by the 10.9 train, being accompanied to the station by Miss Williams, an agreeable young lady who is also a bell–ringer. Our train was delayed by the necessity of giving place to the Royal 'special', which was carrying their Majesties from Windsor to Lambton. A young lady got into the carriage, who soon revealed the fact that she was on her way to Lambton to join the house party in welcoming Their Majesties! I arrived something after 5 p.m.
Noel came to write letters for me. I sent off to Hugh Rees a bundle of 8 sermons to be made up into a little volume for presentation as a Christmas gift.
